hierarchy.entry_subdomain: Third-Party and Supply Chain Asset Inventory

active_learning.discussion_prompt: How would you apply this concept in your work environment?
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Supplier Component Tracking (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Asset Security > Asset Provisioning > Asset Identification and Inventory > Third-Party and Supply Chain Asset Inventory > Supplier Component Tracking). Use the provided learning objectives, active learning components, scaffolding layers (1-4), and research context to create 25 high-quality flashcards. Key Content Sources (complete citations): - NIST SP 800-161r1: Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management Practices (https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-161r1.pdf) - NISTIR 8276: Key Practices in Cyber Supply Chain Risk Management (CSCRM) Considerations for ICT Product and Service Consumers (https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/ir/2023/NIST.IR.8276.pdf) Emphasizes practices like obtaining SBOMs, supplier due diligence, continuous monitoring. - NIST CSF 2.0 GV.SC: Govern Supply Chain Risk Management (https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework) - CISA SBOM: https://www.cisa.gov/sbom - Examples: SolarWinds supply chain attack, Log4j vulnerability. Incorporate university pedagogy: Align to Bloom's objectives, scaffold progressively, embed active learning (e.g., scenario cards for problem-solving). Strictly follow the flashcard schema: JSON array output only. Ensure distractors are protocol-compliant. Cards must promote active recall, spaced repetition best practices, and full topic coverage.
